ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned to apply corporate finance principles to real-world scenarios by studying a variety of cases and evaluating decision-making by business leaders.
Valuation methods, how to analyze different cases and scenarios (bankruptcy, restructuring, capital structure, IPO's, etc.)
I learned a lot of key concepts related to corporate finance by taking this class. I was able to learn a lot more by collaborating with SOM students in the class to push my understanding further.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoy looking at the concepts through actual, real-world case studies. It helps give me a vision on how the concepts are actually applied in practice.

Strengths: Heavy emphasis on group casework & lecturer was excellent, very highly engaging Weaknesses: Quizzes are quite difficult because they're timed (like 5-10min), having written-out longer quizzes would ensure we truly understand the material
This class is extremely thorough in content, collaborative in nature, and organized by topic. I have no suggestions on how it could be improved.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to a student who is interested in seeing how corporate finance topics apply to the real world.

Yes! Especially as an undergraduate, it was really nice to take a course at the SOM with non-Yale College students. I learned a lot about Finance over the course of the semester as the professor is excellent and every lecture has been highly engaging.

I would highly recommend this class to other students. The content in the class, as well as how you learn it through case-based projects, is extremely interesting and engaging. I learned so much practical knowledge about corporate finance, which I don't think I would have gotten otherwise.

Absolutely. Case studies as a style of learning are much more realistic and practical; as a consequence, they are much more complicated. Thus, I believe, they compliment the learning styles of other classes at Yale College. Highly recommend!
